result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Samson Ervin Bahrke

records.addlTxt:
9:56 AM Defendant Michael Samson Ervin Bahrke appeared by zoom.  Attorney Roger L. Klopp appeared by video for Michael Samson Ervin Bahrke.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Klopp states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Burdon filed the information electronically with the Court but will need to file an amended information; requests an arraignment be set.  Atty Klopp agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Arraignment
bond continued
Arraignment scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
and Motion to Adjourn Preliminary Hearing

2:05 PM Defendant Michael Samson Ervin Bahrke appeared by video.  Attorney Roger L. Klopp appeared by video for Michael Samson Ervin Bahrke.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
2022CT000012, 2022TR000153 tracking with 22CF78:
Atty Klopp had mail returned and asks for a current address. Court confirms address and phone. Defendant gives new address.  Atty Klopp states that the matter is not resolved at this time because he has not seen the offer yet; requests a waiver of Prelim be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set waiver of Prelim
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael Samson Ervin Bahrke
Current: 1329 Brawley St., Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 06-22-2022)
Prior: 2201 Carmel Ct, Plover, WI 54467

*Maintain Absolute Sobriety  *No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
(No cash is needed to be posted since it was already posted on 22CT12 and transferred to this case)

10:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Samson Ervin Bahrke not in court.  Attorney Roger L. Klopp appeared by video for Michael Samson Ervin Bahrke. 
2022TR000153 tracking with 22CF78:
Atty Klopp states that he did speak with the defendant a little bit ago and he will be joining zoom shortly.

Defendant Mr. Bahrke now appears by zoom.  
Court questions the defendant as to why he didn't appear right away.  Defendant forgot it was the 15th.  
Atty Klopp states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Klopp waives time limits for the Prelim.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Juech states that bond was set in 22CT12 and asks that the bond remain.  Court notes that there was a motion to dismiss in June.  Atty Klopp states that there was a previous bond but that case was dismissed; requests a signature bond on the CF case.

Atty Juech believes a cash bond is appropriate due to the defendant now facing a felony OWI.  

BY THE COURT:  Court believes that the $750 cash bond is appropriate; no additional cash is needed since it was posted on 22CT12 already and transferred to this case.
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol 

bond will need to be signed but no additional cash to be posted
Status hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
